column1: Halep & Cahill Make It Official For 2016
column3: It's official - Simona Halep's personal coach, starting in January 2016, will be Darren Cahill. The Australian helped take the Romanian back up to No.2 in the world this year.
Things may not have panned out for her in Singapore, but there's a very shiny silver lining for Simona Halep: the World No.2 has secured the year-end World No.2 ranking.
From the elite eight to WTA legends and Paloma Faith, a star-studded line-up stepped out for the Singapore Tennis Evening at Marina Bay Sands. All the best pics here!
Agnieszka Radwanska chalked up her 500th career victory on Thursday afternoon to keep alive her dreams of glory at the BNP Paribas WTA Finals Singapore presented by SC Global.

column1: 10 Things To Know: Thursday In Singapore
column3: Which two of these four WTA megastars will advance to the final four in Singapore? It all comes down to Thursday's matches - get ready for a big, big day right here.
Maria Sharapova held off an inspired second set fightback to edge Simona Halep in a blockbuser round robin match in Singapore. What milestone did the former No.1 hit?

column1: 10 Things To Know: Halep Vs Sharapova
column3: Who leads the head-to-head? Who's going for their 50th win of the year? Can either of them qualify for the semifinals by winning this match? Get ready for a blockbuster!

column1: Halep Comes Out Firing In Singapore
column3: Simona Halep came out firing in her first match of the BNP Paribas WTA Finals Singapore presented by SC Global, getting swift revenge against her US Open conqueror.
